opensource.title: Open Source Countdown
opensource.subtitle: Kaitu is going open source
opensource.description: We're committed to open-sourcing the Kaitu core code, allowing everyone to review, verify, and contribute code, building together a more secure and transparent network tool.
opensource.releasedDesc: Kaitu core code is now open source on GitHub. Visit our repository to view code, submit issues, or contribute.
opensource.reason1Desc: Open source code allows everyone to review our implementation, ensuring no backdoors or malicious code, building genuine trust.
opensource.reason2Desc: Open source enables developers worldwide to participate, submitting improvements and fixes, making the product better.
opensource.reason3Desc: More eyes means faster discovery and fixing of security vulnerabilities. Open source software is often more secure than closed source.
opensource.reason4Desc: We believe technology should benefit everyone. Open source allows everyone to learn and use advanced network technology.
